title: Dying abilities
body: I dont understand why some champs abilities wither into thin air when they die and others go through in the event of death.  An example is velkoz e vs. xerath q.  Xerath's q goes off if cast even if he dies instantly afterward and before the q damage even hits anything.  However, velkoz e winds up if he casts it and if he dies before it hits it dissipates into thin fuckin air.  Makes no sense to me.  There are other examples of this to.  The ability was cast and  it just disappears wtf is that.  it can actually make a pretty huge difference to for example when getting dove under tower and you need that extra bit of cc on someone to trade kills, or obviously to just win close team fights.  My question is Why is there no consistency on the matter??  Why not have all abilities disappear into wispy thin air or all abilities get cast in death?  Really irritating let me know what you think.

replies.body:
If the ability is a projectile, assume it's going to disappear unless otherwise stated.

If the ability is instant application, it's going to do it anyways so long as they didn't die before they finished casting - because it's instant.

Xerath's [Q] is an instant AoE spell, but his [E] is a projectile. Guess which disappears after death.
This is false, Lucians Q reacts the same way as Xerath's Q but Lucians Disappears.
no, lucian has a long cast time, Xerath doesn't

clarification:
Lucian's is lazer instantly occurs after cast animation is finished, since he has a longer cast animation than xerath you can "Fizzle" the spell out by killing him mid cast, since xerath has an instant cast  it almost can't fizzle

Goddamn, it's like you didn't even read.

Lucian's [Q] works just like Xerath's. If they don't finish the animation, the spell doesn't go off. If the spell went off, it's instant application in a given AoE, so it doesn't matter if they die so long as it happens after the point of time said application happened.
Projectile spells (no matter their size or shape) are affected by time in their positioning, so because of their travel time, they aren't in all areas at once like Lucian's or Xerath's [Q] would be.

To think I have to re-explain simple fucking game mechanics.

I said "assume unless otherwise stated". This implies there are exceptions that we all very well know exist.
except they arent stated they just happen to be like that with no explanation as to why

This has been an annoying issue for some time; thresh's hook will hold someone down if he dies during cast, but blitzcrank's doesn't. Lux's lazer fires off even if she dies before casting, but jinx rocket never fires (and still goes on cooldown) if she dies during the cast. I agree these kinds of inconsistencies are getting annoying, and more so from not being addressed what-so-ever.

He had no attack speed because ap and low e rankings, so there was a huge delay, but it still hit me for about 500 magic damage and killed me. I mean sure, if its about to hit me as he dies by all means. But if he just started swinging with it and the auto was winding up, No. I've also had it where I killed someone while playing twisted fate during the windup for the auto but before the auto actually hits them.

It depends on the cast
if it was still casting in some way when you die then it's cancelled
Let's take veigar W for example
He casts it fast, it's alive and running from there on, independently of veigars state, the existence of the projectile is done, I notice most top down abilities are like that, most of Ziggs abilities are like that
then you have the channeled abilities, let's take an obvious one like Malzahar ulti, it has a long cast, since it's a constant cast, if he dies it stops casting all together
A less obvious example would be like Velkoz, most of his abilities have a double cast system, like you said

Then you have the weird ones that "come back" those are the truly inconsistent ones, Ahri, Ekko, Talo, Gnar, some of those still hit coming back even if the host is dead and some don't, why exactly? no idea
